H0.text: The kinetic molecular theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H1.text: Molecular theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H2.text: Charles's Law is the theory of gases that explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H3.text: Kinetic theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

A4.text: The kinetic theory of gases uses collisions of particles with container walls to explain pressure.

A5.text: The application of kinetic theory to ideal gases assumes negligible particle volume and elastic collisions.

A6.text: The equation of state for an ideal gas is discussed in relation to the kinetic molecular theory.

A7.text: Introduction to the kinetic molecular theory of gases is provided by educational resources.
